content: This Italian physicist is best known for his development of the first nuclear reactor, the Chicago Pile-1.

I believe you're referring to Enrico Fermi. He was an Italian physicist who played a crucial role in the development of the first nuclear reactor, known as the Chicago Pile-1, during the Manhattan Project. Fermi was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1938 for his work on induced radioactivity. His contributions to physics were extensive, and he is often regarded as one of the greatest scientists of the 20th century.
